trans-unit.source: ms.ContentId: 526e4f1a-2936-4c61-b3be-d41b4cf9d10f title: About Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: ms.ContentId: 526e4f1a-2936-4c61-b3be-d41b4cf9d10f title: About Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: Applications fuel innovation in the cloud and mobile era.
trans-unit.target: Applications fuel innovation in the cloud and mobile era.

trans-unit.source: Containers, and the ecosystem that is developing around them, will empower software developers to create the next generation of applications experiences.
trans-unit.target: Containers, and the ecosystem that is developing around them, will empower software developers to create the next generation of applications experiences.

trans-unit.source: Watch a short overview: [Windows-based containers: Modern app development with enterprise-grade control](https://youtu.be/Ryx3o0rD5lY ).
trans-unit.target: Watch a short overview: [Windows-based containers: Modern app development with enterprise-grade control](https://youtu.be/Ryx3o0rD5lY ).

trans-unit.source: What are containers?
trans-unit.target: What are containers?

trans-unit.source: They are an isolated, resource controlled, and portable operating environment.
trans-unit.target: They are an isolated, resource controlled, and portable operating environment.

trans-unit.source: Basically, a container is an isolated place where an application can run without affecting the rest of the system and without the system affecting the application.
trans-unit.target: Basically, a container is an isolated place where an application can run without affecting the rest of the system and without the system affecting the application.

trans-unit.source: Containers are the next evolution in virtualization.
trans-unit.target: Containers are the next evolution in virtualization.

trans-unit.source: If you were inside a container, it would look very much like you were inside a freshly installed physical computer or a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you were inside a container, it would look very much like you were inside a freshly installed physical computer or a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: And, to [Docker](https://www.docker.com/), a Windows Server Container can be managed in the same way as any other container.
trans-unit.target: And, to [Docker](https://www.docker.com/), a Windows Server Container can be managed in the same way as any other container.

trans-unit.source: Container Fundamentals
trans-unit.target: Container Fundamentals

trans-unit.source: When you begin working with containers you will notice many similarities between a container and a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: When you begin working with containers you will notice many similarities between a container and a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: A container runs an operating system, has a file system and can be accessed over a network just as if it was a physical or virtual computer system.
trans-unit.target: A container runs an operating system, has a file system and can be accessed over a network just as if it was a physical or virtual computer system.

trans-unit.source: That said, the technology and concepts behind containers are very different from that of virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: That said, the technology and concepts behind containers are very different from that of virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: [This blog post](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/08/17/containers-docker-windows-and-trends/) by Mark Russinovich explains containers well.
trans-unit.target: [This blog post](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/08/17/containers-docker-windows-and-trends/) by Mark Russinovich explains containers well.

trans-unit.source: The following key concepts will be helpful as you begin creating and working with Windows Server Containers.
trans-unit.target: The following key concepts will be helpful as you begin creating and working with Windows Server Containers.

trans-unit.source: **Container Host:** Physical or Virtual computer system configured with the Windows Server Container feature.
trans-unit.target: **Container Host:** Physical or Virtual computer system configured with the Windows Server Container feature.

trans-unit.source: The container host will run one or more Windows Server Containers.
trans-unit.target: The container host will run one or more Windows Server Containers.

trans-unit.source: **Container Image:** As modifications are made to a containers file system or registry, such as with software installation they are captured in the sandbox.
trans-unit.target: **Container Image:** As modifications are made to a containers file system or registry, such as with software installation they are captured in the sandbox.

trans-unit.source: In many cases you may want to capture this state such that new containers can be created that inherit these changes.
trans-unit.target: In many cases you may want to capture this state such that new containers can be created that inherit these changes.

trans-unit.source: That’s what an image is – once the container has stopped you can either discard that sandbox or you can convert it into a new container image.
trans-unit.target: That’s what an image is – once the container has stopped you can either discard that sandbox or you can convert it into a new container image.

trans-unit.source: For example, let’s imagine that you have deployed a container from the Windows Server Core OS image.
trans-unit.target: For example, let’s imagine that you have deployed a container from the Windows Server Core OS image.

trans-unit.source: You then install MySQL into this container.
trans-unit.target: You then install MySQL into this container.

trans-unit.source: Creating a new image from this container would act as a deployable version of the container.
trans-unit.target: Creating a new image from this container would act as a deployable version of the container.

trans-unit.source: This image would only contain the changes made (MySQL), however would work as a layer on top of the Container OS Image.
trans-unit.target: This image would only contain the changes made (MySQL), however would work as a layer on top of the Container OS Image.

trans-unit.source: **Sandbox:** Once a container has been started, all write actions such as file system modifications, registry modifications or software installations are captured in this ‘sandbox’ layer.
trans-unit.target: **Sandbox:** Once a container has been started, all write actions such as file system modifications, registry modifications or software installations are captured in this ‘sandbox’ layer.

trans-unit.source: **Container OS Image:** Containers are deployed from images.
trans-unit.target: **Container OS Image:** Containers are deployed from images.

trans-unit.source: The container OS image is the first layer in potentially many image layers that make up a container.
trans-unit.target: The container OS image is the first layer in potentially many image layers that make up a container.

trans-unit.source: This image provides the operating system environment.
trans-unit.target: This image provides the operating system environment.

trans-unit.source: A Container OS Image is Immutable, it cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: A Container OS Image is Immutable, it cannot be modified.

trans-unit.source: **Container Repository:** Each time a container image is created the container image and its dependencies are stored in a local repository.
trans-unit.target: **Container Repository:** Each time a container image is created the container image and its dependencies are stored in a local repository.

trans-unit.source: These images can be reused many times on the container host.
trans-unit.target: These images can be reused many times on the container host.

trans-unit.source: The container images can also be stored in a public or private repository such as DockerHub so that they can be used across many different container host.
trans-unit.target: The container images can also be stored in a public or private repository such as DockerHub so that they can be used across many different container host.

trans-unit.source: **Container Management Technology:** Windows Server Containers can be managed using both PowerShell and Docker.
trans-unit.target: **Container Management Technology:** Windows Server Containers can be managed using both PowerShell and Docker.

trans-unit.source: With either one of these tools you can create new containers, container images as well as manage the container lifecycle.
trans-unit.target: With either one of these tools you can create new containers, container images as well as manage the container lifecycle.

trans-unit.source: Containers for Developers
trans-unit.target: Containers for Developers

trans-unit.source: From a developer’s desktop to a testing machine to a set of production machines, a Docker image can be created that will deploy identically across any environment in seconds.
trans-unit.target: From a developer’s desktop to a testing machine to a set of production machines, a Docker image can be created that will deploy identically across any environment in seconds.

trans-unit.source: This story has created a massive and growing ecosystem of applications packaged in Docker containers, with DockerHub, the public containerized-application registry that Docker maintains, currently publishing more than 180,000 applications in the public community repository.
trans-unit.target: This story has created a massive and growing ecosystem of applications packaged in Docker containers, with DockerHub, the public containerized-application registry that Docker maintains, currently publishing more than 180,000 applications in the public community repository.

trans-unit.source: When you containerize an app, only the app and the components needed to run the app are combined into an "image".
trans-unit.target: When you containerize an app, only the app and the components needed to run the app are combined into an "image".

trans-unit.source: Containers are then created from this image as you need them.
trans-unit.target: Containers are then created from this image as you need them.

trans-unit.source: You can also use an image as a baseline to create another image, making image creation even faster.
trans-unit.target: You can also use an image as a baseline to create another image, making image creation even faster.

trans-unit.source: Multiple containers can share the same image, which means containers start very quickly and use fewer resources.
trans-unit.target: Multiple containers can share the same image, which means containers start very quickly and use fewer resources.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can use containers to spin up light-weight and portable app components – or ‘micro-services’ – for distributed apps and quickly scale each service separately.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can use containers to spin up light-weight and portable app components – or ‘micro-services’ – for distributed apps and quickly scale each service separately.

trans-unit.source: Because the container has everything it needs to run your application, they are very portable and can run on any machine that is running Windows Server 2016.
trans-unit.target: Because the container has everything it needs to run your application, they are very portable and can run on any machine that is running Windows Server 2016.

trans-unit.source: You can create and test containers locally, then deploy that same container image to your company's private cloud, public cloud or service provider.
trans-unit.target: You can create and test containers locally, then deploy that same container image to your company's private cloud, public cloud or service provider.

trans-unit.source: The natural agility of Containers supports modern app development patterns in large scale, virtualized and cloud environments.
trans-unit.target: The natural agility of Containers supports modern app development patterns in large scale, virtualized and cloud environments.

trans-unit.source: With containers, developers can build an app in any language.
trans-unit.target: With containers, developers can build an app in any language.

trans-unit.source: These apps are completely portable and can run anywhere - laptop, desktop, server, private cloud, public cloud or service provider - without any code changes.
trans-unit.target: These apps are completely portable and can run anywhere - laptop, desktop, server, private cloud, public cloud or service provider - without any code changes.

trans-unit.source: Containers helps developers build and ship higher-quality applications, faster.
trans-unit.target: Containers helps developers build and ship higher-quality applications, faster.

trans-unit.source: Containers for IT Professionals
trans-unit.target: Containers for IT Professionals

trans-unit.source: IT Professionals can use containers to provide standardized environments for their development, QA, and production teams.
trans-unit.target: IT Professionals can use containers to provide standardized environments for their development, QA, and production teams.

trans-unit.source: They no longer have to worry about complex installation and configuration steps.
trans-unit.target: They no longer have to worry about complex installation and configuration steps.

trans-unit.source: By using containers, systems administrators abstract away differences in OS installations and underlying infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: By using containers, systems administrators abstract away differences in OS installations and underlying infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Containers help admins create an infrastructure that is simpler to update and maintain.
trans-unit.target: Containers help admins create an infrastructure that is simpler to update and maintain.
